text: The M62 is a motorway in Northern England. It connects Liverpool and Manchester with Leeds and Hull. It is about long. Around seven miles of the motorway is shared with the M60. ==Junctions== {| border=1 cellpadding=2 style="margin-left:1em; margin-bottom: 1em; color: black; border-collapse: collapse; font-size: Newport B1230 Non-motorway traffic | End of motorway Road continues as A63 towards Hull ==Major incidents== In 1974, the Provisional Irish Republican Army bombed a coach, killing 12 people. In 2001, a car veered off the road onto a railway track, causing a train crash which killed 10 people. ==Coordinates== ==References== Category:Motorways in England
title: M62 motorway
